titles: A letter of a great victory obtained by Sir Miles Livesey, neer Kingstone, on Friday July 7. 1648. The Duke of Buckingham routed, where was slain, the Lord Francis Villers, the Duke of Bucking-hams brother Col. Tho. Howard, the Earle of Berkshires son, 20 officers and souldiers, the Earle of Holland hurt, 200 wounded, 200 horse taken, 100 taken prisoners, &c.
author: Frierson, Henry.
publisher: Printed by Robert Ibbitson in Smithfield neere to the Queens-Head Tavern,
notes: Signed at end of letter: Hen. Frierson.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Campaigns --  Early works to 1800.
Kingston upon Thames (London, England) --  History --  17th century --  Early works to 1800.
